N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 118.8 - Procedures for review and determination of school district responsibility

State Regulations
(a) Administrative
review. A school district that receives notice that it has been identified as
being responsible for the educational costs of a student pursuant to Education

Law, section 3202(7)(b) may request the commissioner to review such
identification by submitting a written statement denying financial
responsibility for such child within 20 days of its receipt of such notice. Such statement shall be in a form prescribed by the commissioner, shall state
the reason for denying financial responsibility and shall be accompanied by any
documentation available to the school district concerning the actual residence
of the student. The commissioner may request that the correctional facility in
which the student was incarcerated provide such additional information
concerning the actual residence of the student as the commissioner may require
and which is available. (b) Determination of school district responsibility. (1)

If the commissioner finds that the school
district seeking review pursuant to subdivision (a) of this section is
financially responsible for the student, the commissioner shall notify such
school district of such finding and the basis upon which it was made. (2)

If the commissioner determines that there
is reasonable cause to believe that a school district other than the district
seeking review is financially responsible for educating the student, the
commissioner shall notify such other school district of such finding and shall
afford such other school district with the opportunity to submit a written
statement denying financial responsibility in accordance with subdivision (a)
of this section. After review of all the information available, the
commissioner shall make a final determination of the identity of the school
district responsible for the educational costs of the student, if any, and
shall notify the school districts affected of such determination and the basis
therefor. (3)

If the commissioner
finds that an incarcerated student had no residence in this State at the time
of his or her commitment to custody, a determination that there is no school
district contribution for such student shall be made. Notes
